page.title: 14Boldron Village - Housing
page.content: As in most villages in the Teesdale area,the architecture of the buildings in Boldron displays a shrewd mixture of the very old and the modern styles. The most prominent buildings are the church,chapel and village hall,though the last is a much newer structure. There is a total of 33 houses which, for the most part,stand on each side of the village green.The older houses, together with several farm-buildings, are mostly built of sandstone with the common Teesdale Slate roofs.The oldest of these is Green Cottage on which the date{1561}can be clearly seen. Of the more recently built houses in the village several are bungalows.They have a pleasant variety of styles and building materials which fit in well with the environment.In some cases the older properties have been modernised, cleverly blending the old with the new
